Thank you!

The Northeast Prevention Coalition is launching a week long campaign for teens to shatter the myths about alcohol and drugs. Take a peak.

National Drug and Alcohol Facts Week¬Æ (NDAFW), an annual health observance week, connects teens with experts to SHATTER THE MYTHS¬Æ about drugs and alcohol, with more than 2000 local events every year.

This is the 10th anniversary of NDAFW! It was launched in 2010 by scientists at the National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) to stimulate educational events in communities so teens can learn what science has taught us about drug use and addiction. The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA) became a partner in 2016.

NDAFW events are hosted by schools, local nonprofits/community-based organizations, state/local health departments, Parent Teacher Student Associations (PTSAs), faith-based organizations, afterschool clubs, and more!
